predictions.text: ISM Manufacturing PMI (headline, SA) for October 2025 will print between 49.0 and 50.2 in ISM’s release due by 2025-11-01.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify the October 2025 ISM Manufacturing Report on Business headline PMI (seasonally adjusted). Success if the reported PMI is >= 49.0 and <= 50.2.
evidence: Markets await Fed decision; near-term manufacturing sensitive to rates and inventories.
UPS eliminates 48,000 roles in 2025 amid turnaround, signaling weak volumes.
Softer new orders and elevated prices often align with sub-50 to ~50 headline prints.
monitoring_signals: S&P Global US Manufacturing PMI final for October
Regional Fed surveys (Philly Fed, Empire, Richmond)
ISM supplier deliveries and inventories subindices
Rail/truck freight volumes and inventories-to-sales ratios
predictions.rationale: Mixed demand and inventory adjustment point to a near-50 print.

predictions.text: U.S. unemployment rate (U-3, SA) for October 2025 will print between 4.1% and 4.3% in the BLS Employment Situation release due 2025-11-07.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use BLS Employment Situation, Table A-1, unemployment rate (seasonally adjusted) for October 2025. Success if reported rate is within 4.1%–4.3%.
evidence: Visa results show resilient consumer spending supporting soft-landing narrative.
UPS and Amazon job cuts imply cooling labor demand without collapse.
Recent claims trend consistent with stable unemployment near low-4s.
monitoring_signals: NFIB hiring plans and wage intentions
predictions.rationale: Labor market rebalancing continues with modest slack.

predictions.text: At its early-November 2025 meeting, the Reserve Bank of Australia will leave the cash rate target unchanged at 4.35%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm RBA Board decision published on rba.gov.au for the November 2025 meeting. Success if the cash rate target remains at 4.35%.
evidence: Australia CPI hits 3.2%, highest in over a year, reducing odds of near-term easing.
Global central banks are cautious amid sticky services inflation.
AUD dynamics and housing considerations favor a hold.
monitoring_signals: Australian trimmed mean and services inflation
Labor market prints (employment, wage price index)
predictions.rationale: Above-target inflation and mixed growth argue for a hold.

predictions.text: Nikkei 225 (^N225) will close at or above 52,000.0 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Use official daily close for Nikkei 225 (^N225). Success if any trading day’s close is >= 52,000.0 by the deadline.
evidence: Japan’s Nikkei tops 51,000 for first time, signaling momentum.
USD/JPY strength supports exporters and equity risk appetite.
Fed policy path may underpin global equities.
monitoring_signals: USD/JPY levels and BOJ policy guidance
Earnings from Japan’s exporters and tech
predictions.rationale: Momentum, weak yen, and earnings support incremental highs.

predictions.text: By 2025-11-30, North Korea will conduct at least one additional ballistic missile launch publicly acknowledged by South Korea’s JCS or Japan’s MOD.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirmation via official statements from ROK JCS or Japan MOD, or wire reports (Reuters/AP/AFP) citing those authorities, of a ballistic missile launch during the window.
evidence: North Korea fires missile ahead of Trump’s South Korea visit, heightening tensions.
Historical patterns of clustered tests around high-profile events.
Ongoing regional security frictions increase launch incentives.
monitoring_signals: NOTAMs and maritime advisories in region
predictions.rationale: Escalatory signaling tends to persist around key diplomatic moments.

predictions.text: The S&P 500 Index (^GSPC) will close up at least 2.0% day-over-day on at least one UTC trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Calculate daily percentage change from official prior close to close for ^GSPC. Success if any day’s change is >= +2.00% by the deadline.
evidence: Markets await Fed decision; policy shifts can spark relief rallies.
Earnings season and macro prints can catalyze large moves.
Volatility sensitive to geopolitical headlines.
monitoring_signals: FOMC decision and press conference tone
VIX term structure and options positioning
predictions.rationale: Event-rich calendar raises odds of a relief or squeeze rally.

predictions.text: USD/JPY (JPY=X) will trade at or above 153.50 on at least one UTC trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify an intraday print on Yahoo Finance (JPY=X) at or above 153.50 on any UTC trading day by the deadline.
evidence: Japan’s Nikkei surge aligns with a weaker yen backdrop.
BOJ’s gradualism and U.S. yields keep upside risks for USD/JPY.
Intervention risk tempers, but does not preclude, tests of highs.
monitoring_signals: BOJ policy guidance and JGB yield moves
U.S. Treasury yields and rate differentials
predictions.rationale: Wide rate differentials and risk-on tilt support yen weakness.

predictions.text: U.S. Advance Retail Sales excluding motor vehicles and parts dealers (MoM, SA) for October 2025 will print between -0.1% and +0.3% in the Census release due mid-November.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use the Census Bureau Advance Monthly Retail Trade Report for October 2025; verify the MoM percent change for Retail and Food Services excluding motor vehicles and parts dealers (seasonally adjusted). Success if within -0.1% to +0.3%.
evidence: Visa results show resilient consumer spending and cross-border volumes.
UPS volumes weak suggest softer goods demand, netting to modest growth.
Gasoline price relief may reallocate spend to services and staples.
monitoring_signals: Gasoline prices and real disposable income
predictions.rationale: Steady but modest spending amid mixed goods demand.

predictions.text: S&P CoreLogic Case-Shiller 20-City Home Price Index (YoY, NSA) for September 2025 will print between 1.5% and 3.0%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify the year-over-year percent change for the 20-City Composite (NSA) in the September 2025 S&P CoreLogic Case-Shiller release. Success if within 1.5%–3.0%.
evidence: U.S. home price gains trail inflation, eroding real gains.
Higher mortgage rates continue to cap affordability and demand.
Inventory constraints moderate but do not eliminate weakness.
monitoring_signals: Active listings and months of supply
Pending home sales and builder sentiment
predictions.rationale: Higher rates and affordability issues slow nominal price gains.

predictions.text: ICE BofA MOVE Index will close at or above 115.0 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Use the published daily close of the ICE BofA MOVE Index. Success if any close is >= 115.0 by the deadline.
evidence: Markets await Fed decision; policy shifts can elevate rate vol.
Treasury market liquidity and auction outcomes remain fragile.
Geopolitical risks can spill into rates volatility.
predictions.rationale: Event risk and liquidity strains can spike rates vol episodically.
